message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Equity Ratio.

• From the balance sheet, Total Liabilities are given by Total Current Liabilities = 5,042,389.63.
• Total Owner’s Equity is 16,056,497.85.
• Debt to Equity Ratio = (Total Liabilities) / (Total Owner’s Equity) = 5,042,389.63 / 16,056,497.85 ≈ 0.314
• Rounded to two decimals: 0.31

Step 2. Calculate the Net Profit Margin.

• From the income statement, Net Profit = 56,497.85 and Total Revenue = 547,392.30.
• Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (56,497.85 / 547,392.30) × 100 ≈ 10.32%

Step 3. Calculate the Return on Assets (ROA).

• Total Assets from the balance sheet = 21,098,887.48.
• ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100 = (56,497.85 / 21,098,887.48) × 100 ≈ 0.27%

Step 4. Calculate the Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio.

• Accounts Receivable as of 2024-02-05 = 200,359.99.
• Using a convention for average accounts receivable where the beginning (2023-12-31) is 0 and the ending is 200,359.99, the average is (0 + 200,359.99) / 2 = 100,180.00 (approximately).
• Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Accounts Receivable = 547,392.30 / 100,180.00 ≈ 5.47

Thus, the final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.31",
    "Net Profit Margin": "10.32%",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "0.27%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "5.47"
  }
}
